column_.text_:
I trusted only my fists. If you wish to reach transcendence, you must beat out the path with your
own knuckles.

Which is why, when my fists began to tremble in anticipation, I listened. It was as if they
whispered, "A terrible future awaits these skies. Fail to act, and unprecedented calamity will befall
you!"

How could they know? In truth, they knew more than most scholars, having experienced the
rigors of fundamental ascetic practice. I tempered them relentlessly, until they could foretell which
timeline would lead them to the most strength.
But, you may ask, how far can one go with omnipotent fists?
A foolish question!

Only cowards measure progress in distance! In achievement! Blood boils through these fingers!
That is all I need to know!
Ahhh, I feel the fire raging inside. The storm has arrived...
And I shall catch it with my bare hands!
"Divinity above, I wish you no ill will. But your defeat shall be evidence of my life's work."

Vow recited, I ended the evening's meditation. Decades of such ascetic training had finally born
fruit.
I had honed the Eternal Rage Style to a godlike edge.
But the long years had also revealed to me an enemy I could never defeat: time itself.
My inevitable demise meant there would be no more Eternal Rage Style.
I would need a disciple. Someone worthy of inheriting my technique.

Of course, coal is not transformed into diamond so easily. It would be a fool's errand to find a
successor who could survive the necessary time and rigor.
Thus, when I finally met , I was happy to be that fool. Now I could pass on my legacy.
But  had another goal in mind: to reach Estalucia and reunite with dear old papa.
But  had another goal in mind: to reach Estalucia and reunite with dear old papa.

Filial piety was a respectable tenet, but it was no god-shattering fist. Despite my pleas, I failed to
convince  to become my pupil.

Filial piety was a respectable tenet, but it was no god-shattering fist. Despite my pleas, I failed to
convince  to become my pupil.

However, something must have resonated with the young master, because I received an invitation
to join the Grandcypher's crew! If I could not produce a scion of Eternal Rage, at least I would gain
new allies.

However, something must have resonated with the young master, because I received an invitation
to join the Grandcypher's crew! If I could not produce a scion of Eternal Rage, at least I would gain
new allies.

Walking aboard the airship, my fists buzzed. Hah! So there would be something more to this
meeting after all!

Worthy , I chose then to fight by your side, for the glory of the crew! For the glory of
reaching Estalucia!
And, after we return...
We shall discuss your future with the Eternal Rage Style in earnest!
"You heard all the stories about the old man, right?"
I could hardly believe my ears.

Ripping the Grim Basin apart with a single punch? Joining a war just so he could spar... and
defeating both sides?! Knocking over a whole mountain just from turning in his sleep?

I call BS. And just like crap, there was probably a kernel of truth in there somewhere, but come
on. Who believes this stuff?

Heh. Turns out, idiots like me. See, I've actually witnessed Ghandagoza smash a meteor into
space dust.
"You think people will catch onto that story too?"

"Course they will. Why else do people go to the pub? Man's favorite past time is recountin' tales of
people braver than themselves."
"But it's so hard to believe. And I saw him do the damn thing."

So, yep. Though the old master's legends were numerous—and honestly, downright
ridiculous—they were also the truth.

What's crazier, Ghanda would never toot his own horn. After crushing a dragon with a sneeze, or
what have you, he'd just say...
Yep. Actions speak louder than words. That's a real man's man for ya. You gotta admire that.
"What I would give for his rippling biceps though..."

Looking back now, none of us could have known. There, in the Zegagrande Skydom, Ghandagoza
was about to use those rippling biceps to start a whole, brand new mythos.
Siero gave us the news.

A lone brawler managed to stop a force of hundreds atop Mt. Neigelith, all while quelling a raging
blizzard. With his bare hands?

I'm not a bettin' man... Well, I'm not a drinkin' man, but... Well, I'm not a man who bets when he
drinks, but I'd put good money on our brawler being Ghandagoza.

It hadn't been that long since we sailed to Zegagrande, so the ol' badger must've been workin'
overtime for word to spread so quick.

I asked Siero to spill the details. The force he scattered was a group of soldiers, remnants of the
Church of Avia. And word was, they were specialists in guerilla warfare.

Sure as hell they were a fierce troop. How does an unarmed martial artist take 'em all out? Not
that I could ask the master... 'Cause you know what he'd say.
But hey. Who needs words when you've got those defined shoulder blades doin' the talkin'?
Guess it was just one more legend for the books.
"Call for reinforcements! We need all the support we can get!"
"Why is everyone from that crew a beast? What are they feeding them on that ship?!"
It was a nightmare. Actually, worse. You could wake up from a nightmare. This was our reality.
We were being driven into the heart of Mt. Neigelith by a single skyfarer.

Even though he was alone, he was with the crew who defeated General Gallanza. Our only chance
was to put aside our pride and work together to take him down.

Our platoon was experienced, and we could launch the prototype tayu'itar if things started looking
rough.

We had numbers and strategy on our side. With all of our preparations, victory should have been
assured.
But he took one look at our perfect formations... and laughed.

"Gah-hah-hah! You honor me with this extra training! I, Ghandagoza, shall now return the favor...
with Eternal Raaage!"
You what?
This guy was nuts. All of these soldiers, and this was just a field exercise to him?
"Get your asses in gear! Do not break ranks!"

Command snapped my mind back into focus. I drew my sword, but as I clutched its hilt, I had
never been more sure it was just a hunk of scrap metal.
Keep your distance! Or you won't make it out of here alive!
Roger!
Hyaaah! How will you train from so far away?!

He doesn't even have a weapon. Is this a joke to him? Who is
this guy?

Could be the devil himself, for all I care! Where's our back
up? We can't take him on our own!
Step forward! I still need to finish my warm-up!
Gah-hah! My fists grow restless!
Eeep!
Curse our luck... He's leaving me with no option...
Switch to Plan C.
Plan C! But, sir, he doesn't even have armor on...
Just do it!
Either we deploy our secret weapon, or he'll wipe us out!
Go, tayu'itar! Deliver us from this accursed giant!
Hm? I applaud your desire to continue fighting...
But, ngaaaaargh! You insult me with these useless toys!
It's hopeless. He took out the tayu'itar.

Of course he did... I want all units deployed! Courage, troops.
No one lives forever!
With these fists, nothing is impossible!
Victory is mine!
He's... a monster...
Commander, your orders!
Commander?
It was a nightmare. Actually, worse. You could wake up from a nightmare. This was our reality.
"Where are they?! Bring me your champions!"

We were an entire platoon of Pilgrims; we even deployed the tayu'itar. He wasn't even
inconvenienced!
"Retreat! Retreat!"
My mind was cloudy. I barely heard the commander's order.
How could I think? I saw it. I saw the force of his punches redirect the blizzard.
He had to be a demon. No mortal could beat the damn weather into submission!

Not to mention the lack of corpses. This battle had been brutal, but so far no one had sustained
critical injuries. Which means he had been holding back.
A man like this, he was as strong as General Gallanza. No... Stronger, maybe.

Finally, I gathered enough sense to unfreeze my feet and turn tail. As I ran away, I got the sense I
had just witnessed history in the making.

I will fondly remember my splendid time atop Mt. Neigelith. Deadly blizzard pummeling my flesh,
freezing cold stabbing my lungs, and swarms of monsters looking to turn me into a long overdue
meal.

These were already the perfect conditions for training, but sweet, generous fortune had even
more in store. I crested a snowy knoll, and what should I see but the Aviaeth crusaders setting
camp for their own war games!
Follow the fist! For it shall lead to serendipity!

Unfortunately, however, it seemed my newfound sparring partners were on a stricter schedule
than I, as they took their leave before I could properly thank them.
"Ghandagoza! A letter came for you!"
Hm? Now this was a rare occurrence.
"It looks like it's from... Whoa, no way..."
Her mouth was agape. I peered down to read why. "From: Gallanza."
The Silver Wolf Corps general. This would be intriguing.
To: Master Ghandagoza, Distinguished Practitioner of the Eternal Rage Style.
Thank you for meeting my strongest force on the field of battle. They spoke highly of your ferocity.
In fact, some suggest you may be stronger than me. Which is why I demand a duel!
If you are not a coward, meet me in front of Tredame Sanctuary atop Mt. Neigelith! ASAP!
I expect a death match as the skies have never seen before!
Signed: The Invincible and Unparalleled General of the Silver Wolf Corps, Gallanza.
"Oh no, Megapops! You can't go alone! He's way too strong."
"Vyrn's right! Who knows what could happen during a fight with that man?"
What loving kids, to spare their thoughts for me.
But Gallanza was a man of unparalleled battle acumen.
I could not pass on such an opportunity.
To call myself the greatest fighter in all the skies, I must best the greatest fighters in all the skies!

looked at me with trusting eyes, as if to say "Go, noble warrior. This crew believes in
the might of your god-shattering fists."

Seeing the tacit acceptance of their commanding officer, Lyria and Vyrn finally relented, but they
insisted on joining, in case the worst befell me.

Seeing the tacit acceptance of their commanding officer, Lyria and Vyrn finally relented, but they
insisted on joining, in case the worst befell me.
Their support was my tailwind. We left for the battlefield.
"Witness me, children! I shall fight the fight of raaage!"
"Good. You're right on time."

Ghandagoza and Gallanza stood opposite one another. The air was tense, one spark from
exploding.
"Ghandagoza, of the Eternal Rage Style, at your service!"
Ghandagoza spread his legs shoulder-width apart and raised his fists. He was ready for—

"In thiiiis corner, the Silver Wolf himself, Gallanza! And in this corner, a man whose sheer rage is
matched only by his weird beard! Ghandagoza!"
"Ahh! You nearly gave me a heart attack! Where did you come from?"
"Yeah, Ref! What are you doing here? You could get hurt!"

"I've been following the legend of a master martial artist for years. And today, all of us will finally
see his fists reach for the title of strongest! Don't blink or you'll miss it! A new legend is about to
be born!"
"Sounds like somebody could use a reality check..."
Suddenly, things had gone from tense to... weird and tense.
"Now, once again, sky folk of all ages, prepare yourselves fooor..."

"Hey! Don't step on our gig! There's already too many characters in this scene! We'll do the
commentating around here!"
"Vyrn, no! We're not licensed to broadcast!"
But never mind about our qualifications. Something more important was on the line.
"I want a clean fight. Now... Believe in victory... Engage!"

Well, the match of the century has just begun! Who do you
think has the upper hand here, Lyria?
M-me?! I'm no expert, but I want Ghandagoza to win!

There you have it! Our skyfaring heroine has spoken! Her
words are sure to bring strength to her crewmate!
Hey! Is that bias on the mic? You know better than that, ref!

I'd say we're off to a good start. Ghandagoza's fists are as
steadfast as they are quick.

Yes sir, Megapops has one of the strictest training regimens
I've ever seen.

Gallanza's drawn his spear! He'll be able to cover a ton of turf
with that sucker!

Hah! It takes strength to wield a weapon like that! I welcome
this type of pressure!

That was Gallanza's famed Storming Death attack! It's an
advanced technique, where he storms the arena with death!

Ghandagoza is no stranger to bad weather! He should be able
to dodge it all!

Yeah, Megapops has been known to clear a squall with just
his punch, so this should be a cinch!
You honor me! I would expect nothing less of a living legend!

Your flattery is appreciated! Now, come at me with
everything you've got!
Everything? Don't mind if I do! Mwahaha!

Have you ever seen such a furious set of attacks? The end is
nigh!
Go, go, go! Show 'em who's boss!
Ghandagoza put his whole heart in that one! Has he done it?!
Ghandagoza?
I can't look!

Ouch! Ghandagoza goes flying! Will he be able to stand after
that?
Ghandagoza took a shiner! He'll feel that one in the morning!

Ghandagoza, you can't just stand there! Guess he was caught
off guard, folks!
Gallanza is on the edge of the screen!
The famed Arhat Skybreaker! Fury from above!
Let's see if Gallanza takes the bait...
Like a fly to a web!
The Iron Shoulder! I felt that one in my back!
He's powering up now!
He's begging for it! Amazing!
Have you ever seen an Infernal Stomp like that?!
You love to see it! He's full of Eternal Rage now!
Now that is how you focus!

I CAN'T BELIEVE THIS! HE'S DONE IT! THE BLAZING FISTS
OF THE RED LOTUS! AAAHHH!

Here comes the Martial Spear once more! Can Ghandagoza
weasel out of this one?!

Storming Death, back again! Who could withstand such a
mighty attack?

Ghandagoza and Gallanza were going all out. They were like warring primals, blasting each other
with crazy techniques. Finally, when the dust had settled...

"The last man standing is Ghandagoza! Let's hear it for those furious fists of legend, ladies and
gents!"

Megapops pulled off the victory, though Gallanza was no slouch either. Simply put, the stronger
man took the match.
Boy, I wish I were ripped like Ghanda.
If I had his muscles, I bet I coulda stopped that whole Avia mess in two seconds flat...

Oops! Where was I? Right. Megapops had done it again. He'd proven himself in the ring and taken
out one of the skydom's best fighters. Score one more for the Eternal Rage legacy.

I couldn't wait to get back and tell Rackam and Eugen the good news. They were basically
'Ghandastorians' by now, and this would be one more legend for their repertoire.
"Did Vyrn tell you what ol' Ghanda's been up to lately?"

Fighting off a hundred soldiers? Okay, sure. He's got chops. Pushing back a blizzard? Mmm, I'll
buy it. He's got elemental attunement out the wazoo. But taking out Gallanza? In a deathmatch?!
Sounds like we're all losing our marbles now!

And what's this about their fight being so ferocious it carved out a new valley through Mt.
Neigelith? Has anyone verified that? And turning the island upside down! Come on, people.

Ghanda, folks are starting to take your stories a liiittle too far. That, or you're doing waaay too
much. And I really hope it's the former.
What am I saying? If you ever stop your crazy exploits, I'll eat my helmsman's license.

Yeah... That stoic silence explained it all. For some, an unbelievable legacy might be too heavy to
bear, but I doubt there's anything those broad shoulders couldn't lift.

All of his stories have proven true so far. Maybe, just maybe, he really would sock it to a god one
day.
"I get to read it first, Eugen! I bought the damn thing!"
"Over my dead body! I was just getting to the good part! Hyaaah! Take that! Fist of the Red Lotus!"

My fellow crewmates stood around a wall scroll, fascinated. Rackam procured it from Seedhollow,
I gathered.

But, wait... Had Eugen not just vocalized and then improperly executed one of my techniques?
Bizarre.

While Eugen and Rackam were distracted by their noble bickering, Lyria brought the scroll over.
When she flicked it open, my breath caught.
"Is that me? Is that supposed to be me?"

My likeness, stylized and somehow prettier, was punching back a blizzard in an illogical way.
Don't these petty painters know that one must channel the ferocity of the storm to beat the
storm?
"Someone asked an artist to paint your story! Look how great it turned out!"

I had to admit, they did a decent job of capturing the majesty of my mane, even if it were a bit too
bushy.
"Gah-hah-hah!"

I could not help but laugh. Of all the places my fists had taken me, this was the first where I had
encountered my own facsimile.

Though I hadn't bothered to tell anyone of my training on Mt. Neigelith, perhaps I should be more
vocal in the future.
If not only to add more fan art to my widening legends. What joy that would spread! Gah-hah-hah!
